## Description {#details}

This class represents a function that is read from a sample profile.

It comes with two forms: a string or a hash code. The latter form is the 64-bit <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/md5">MD5</a> of the function name for efficient storage supported by ExtBinary profile format, and when reading the profile, this class can represent it without converting it to a string first. When representing a hash code, we utilize the LengthOrHashCode field to store it, and Name is set to null. When representing a string, it is same as <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a>.

Definition at line 36 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/profiledata/functionid-h">FunctionId.h</a>.

## Public Member Functions

### compare() {#a88477c2cef22acd843d1e9891c26c67c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>int llvm::sampleprof::FunctionId::compare (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sampleprof/functionid">FunctionId</a> &amp; Other) const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Total order comparison.

If both <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sampleprof/functionid">FunctionId</a> are <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a>, this is the same as <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref/#ae0c6424784f132b91eb387a3ee0b57c9">StringRef::compare</a>. If one of them is <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a>, it is considered greater than the hash code <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sampleprof/functionid">FunctionId</a>. Otherwise this is the the same as comparing their int values.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/profiledata/functionid-h/#l00085">85</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/profiledata/functionid-h">FunctionId.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool llvm::sampleprof::FunctionId::empty () const"
  labels = {["inline"]}>

### equals() {#a9256740671ebe9569db9be4859249e43}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool llvm::sampleprof::FunctionId::equals (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sampleprof/functionid">FunctionId</a> &amp; Other) const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/check">Check</a> for equality.

Similar to StringRef::equals, but will also cover for the case where one or both are hash codes. Comparing their int values are sufficient. A hash code <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sampleprof/functionid">FunctionId</a> is considered not equal to a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sampleprof/functionid">FunctionId</a> regardless of actual contents.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/profiledata/functionid-h/#l00076">76</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/profiledata/functionid-h">FunctionId.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getHashCode() {#a5c097d6625bd9e8132f391309e787943}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>uint64&#95;t llvm::sampleprof::FunctionId::getHashCode () const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Get hash code of this object.

Returns this object&#39;s hash code if it is already representing one, otherwise returns the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/md5">MD5</a> of its string content. Note that it is not the same as std::hash because we want to keep the consistency that the same sample profile function in string form or <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/md5">MD5</a> form has the same hash code.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/profiledata/functionid-h/#l00123">123</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/profiledata/functionid-h">FunctionId.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/profiledata/functionid-h/#l00097">97</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/profiledata/functionid-h">FunctionId.h</a>.

### stringRef() {#a36a977f1e2f4b4b0fca324a11d3e3313}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="StringRef llvm::sampleprof::FunctionId::stringRef () const"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Convert to <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a>.

This is only allowed when it is known this object is representing a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a>, not a hash code. Calling this function on a hash code is considered an error.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/profiledata/functionid-h/#l00108">108</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/profiledata/functionid-h">FunctionId.h</a>.

## Private Static Functions

### compareMemory() {#af3c8d6264ba738941d9d2020aa879550}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static int llvm::sampleprof::FunctionId::compareMemory (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> char &#42; Lhs, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> char &#42; Rhs, uint64&#95;t Length)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "static"]}>
<a href="/docs/api/structs/extension">Extension</a> to memcmp to handle hash code representation.

If both are hash values, Lhs and Rhs are both null, function returns 0 (and needs an extra comparison using getIntValue). If only one is hash code, it is considered less than the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> one. Otherwise perform normal string comparison.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/profiledata/functionid-h/#l00048">48</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/profiledata/functionid-h">FunctionId.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>
